result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Atty. Sparr on behalf of the State.  Atty.Fritz and Defendant both appeared in person.   Court denies motion to dismiss.  Case is referred back down to Court Commissioner for a preliminary hearing to be scheduled.  Bond continues.
Motion hearing on April 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:04 AM Defendant RHONDA C. JACOBSON in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Defendant RHONDA C. JACOBSON in custody.  Amanda Lynn Folger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  RHONDA C. JACOBSON appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case was set for Prelim today but the defense attorney filed a motion to dismiss the complaint this morning.  The case will be sent to branch 6 for a motion hearing.  Defense requests to reduce bond to a $3,500 cash bond.  The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law to address bond.  The State objects.  The Court will not amend bond.  Bond Continues.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Time limits tolled. Record closed @ 11:08.

records.addlTxt: NO CONTACT WITH STEPHANIE DEPNER.  NO CONTACT WITH PAUL KAUFMAN.  NO CONTACT WITH ERIK AVERBECK.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  NO POSSESSION OR CONSUMPTION OF ILLEGAL CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES OR DRUG PARAPHERNALIA WITHOUT A VALID PRESCRIPTION.  Comply with the Drug Free 24/7 Program. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  You shall report for fingerprinting and photos pursuant to Wis Stats 970.02(7) to room 15, lower level of the Courthouse.  Due to COVID-19 you will need to call 920-236-4906 BEFORE reporting.
